info.title: OEAW Coins DB
info.general_description: Full mapping of dFMRÖ (digitale FundMünzen der Römischen Zeit in Österreich), a database of ancient coin finds in Austria, to CIDOC-CRM. The mapping was implemented within the ARIADNE project (http://www.ariadne-infrastructure.eu/)

source_info.source_collection: dFMRÖ (digitale FundMünzen der Römischen Zeit in Österreich) (http://www.oeaw.ac.at/numismatik/projekte/dfmroe/dfmroe.html)

mapping_info.mapping_created_by_person: Dr. Edeltraud Aspöck (Edeltraud.Aspoeck@oeaw.ac.at), Dr. Martin Doerr (martin@ics.forth.gr), Maria Theodoridou (maria@ics.forth.gr)

example_data_info.example_data_from: OEAW. The source record is not a real record. It was created for testing purposes. The target record is not yet the full mapping.

comment.rationale: We map local identifiers in relational database tables explicitly only if these identifiers are visible in the user interface and used in other documents as well. Alternatively, we use the local database identifiers only for generating URIs for the record instance, here the coin instance, and do NOT map the COIN.ID at all.

E12 Production [x1]-> Pxx produced things of type -> E55 Type We need to extend the model in order to support categorical production (similar to FRBR R26 produced things of type). Type can take values such as "AU from Rome, mint ..." which characterize the "edition" of the mint that can be recognized to be outcome of the same minting process. Typically we would assume that there is a unique stamp used.
Coin finding event may have types: E10 Transfer of Custody [x2] -> P2 has type -> "Field Collection", "Excavation"
We propose a specialization of property P17 was motivated by (gave order)

"Issuer" is an accidental role and does not characterize an actor independently from particular contexts of activity. Therefore the Actor does not have the type "Issuer" but the activity only has the type "Issuing"
it is a type with 2 possible values: "genuine" and "forgery"
If this info is related to the Find_Spot then we should use the same event. Otherwise we can just map it as note
This is probably a link to a filename with an image of the coin.
with URI AUTHORITY.AUTH_ID authority refers to a period within ancient civilizations
